abstract: As the government cracks down on overdraft fees, banks are mounting an aggressive campaign aimed at retaining billions of dollars in penalty income.
snippet: As the government cracks down on overdraft fees, banks are mounting an aggressive campaign aimed at retaining billions of dollars in penalty income.
lead_paragraph: For many households trying to improve their finances, tossing out pitches from the bank has become almost automatic. But in recent weeks, Chase has been fanning special letters out to consumers with an offer that it urges them not to refuse.

headline.main: Banks Apply Pressure to Keep Fees Rolling In

byline.original: By Andrew Martin and Ron Lieber

abstract: It’s a sign of the changing times at Bank of America: Two Merrill Lynch executives who fled the company are back, The Associated Press reported.
snippet: It’s a sign of the changing times at Bank of America: Two Merrill Lynch executives who fled the company are back, The Associated Press reported.
lead_paragraph: It’s a sign of the changing times at Bank of America: Two Merrill Lynch executives who fled the company are back.

headline.main: BofA Brings 2 Merrill Executives Back to the Fold

abstract: Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner took a little heat last month at the hearing of the House oversight committee, but details about the securities that led to American International Group’s bailout slipped through without much notice.
snippet: Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner took a little heat last month at the hearing of the House oversight committee, but details about the securities that led to American International Group’s bailout slipped through without much notice.
lead_paragraph: Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner took a little heat last month at the hearing of the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform, but details about the securities that led to American International Group‘s bailout slipped through without much notice.

headline.main: Details Out on Bank C.D.O.’s That Sank A.I.G.

abstract: Volatility returned to Wall Street on Monday, ending a four-day winning streak for stocks, as worries over the energy sector overshadowed hopes that banks would continue to bring in generous profits, The New York Times reported.
snippet: Volatility returned to Wall Street on Monday, ending a four-day winning streak for stocks, as worries over the energy sector overshadowed hopes that banks would continue to bring in generous profits, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Volatility returned to Wall Street on Monday, ending a four-day winning streak for stocks, as worries over the energy sector overshadowed hopes that banks would continue to bring in generous profits.

headline.main: Wall Street Exchanges Turn Lower in Closing Minutes

abstract: At least one legacy of the old Merrill Lynch is thriving at Bank of America, Breakingviews says: the kiss-off then embrace-back, Breakingviews says.

abstract: Shareholders of Bank of America on Tuesday approved an increase in the bank’s common shares to finance its repayment of government bailout money.
snippet: Shareholders of Bank of America on Tuesday approved an increase in the bank’s common shares to finance its repayment of government bailout money.
lead_paragraph: Shareholders of Bank of America on Tuesday approved an increase in the bank’s common shares to finance its repayment of government bailout money, The Associated Press reports.
